intro: Crotalaria damarensis, commonly known as the Damara cowpea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which is characterized by its leguminous properties and nitrogen-fixing capabilities. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with erect stems and palmately compound leaves. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, with a distinctive spurred structure on the petals. Crotalaria damarensis is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in arid or semi-arid conditions.
